Summary I have worked professionally with UNIX/Linux, Internet, web and most mainstream Internet related technologies, both as developer/programmer, systems architect, system manager, project manager, CTO/CIO, business developer and strategist. Over the years, I've had the opportunity to introduce these technologies in projects and software used by different fields and industries. Examples can be : Finance, retail, media & publishing, manufacturing, oil & offshore, entertainment, food, and government and the public sector. 
 
My goal is to try to stay up-to-date on both Internet business evolution trends and technology trends, as I believe these impact each other and our society as a whole. 
 
Competencies in no particular order: Social networking technologies, usability, responsive web, mobile web, PaaS, Amazon AWS,Cloud Architectures, SOA, SQL,Business Intelligence (Pentaho, Qlikview), ETL/Integration, Enterprise Architecture, traceability, GIS, GS1 EPCglobal standards (such as EPCIS), Google frameworks, GIS,web technology in general. I have deep knowledge and hands-on experience on core web technology elements like HTTP, HTML5, CSS, XML and Javascript, including Ajax. Currently working much with front-end technologies as jQuery, jQuery UI, jQuery Mobile, Bootstrap, AngularJS, React and other JS frameworks. 
 
Programming: Languages I currently work with at various levels: C, Perl, PHP, Python, Ruby, Java, Javascript, NodeJS. 
 
Tools / methodologies: I am familiar with and use a great number of tools on a daily basis and can easily adapt to any methodology and process framework.
